messages.message:
Hi Team.

I’ve noticed a lot of PEP 420 (https://peps.python.org/pep-0420/) violations (`___init___.py` files that shouldn’t exist), especially in shared-utils.

While this doesn’t affect the build because the build script consolidates the folders together, it does break PyCharm indexing and linting.

To summarize PEP 420:
• Packages which are split across multiple directories in the codebase before the build (i.e. `instabase`) should not have an `__init__.py` file.
• Packages which reside entirely in a single directory should have an `__init__.py` file.
Is there a way to add this check to flake8 so we can flag it more easily going forward?
